All options must be selected before you can continue

The current mortgage balance is the amount you owe and includes all sub accounts. It doesn’t include any interest accrued so far this month, and may not include transactions made in the last few days. This is not a final settlement figure. If you want to know the amount needed to pay off your mortgage in full, please call us. Double tap to go to our contact page

"Current monthly payment. This is the amount that you've agreed to pay on your mortgage each month. It includes the minimum monthly payment, overpayments that you've arranged, insurance premiums (if these are added to your mortgage) and any extra payments to pay off arrears. If you have recently made any changes to your mortgage, the new payment will not show here until you have paid it for the first time. Minimum monthly payment. This is the monthly mortgage payment excluding any extra payments you have agreed to pay-off arrears and you might make for other reasons for example insurance premiums. This is the minimum amount that is payable to us each month to maintain your mortgage agreement. It may go up or down when interest rates change or if you choose to make other changes to your mortgage. We’ll always tell you before we change it."
How is my current balance calculated.
How are my monthly payments calculated.

Mortgage type is %1$s. Mortgage holders are %2$s. Property address is %3$s. Opening date is %4$s. Arrears balance is %5$s. Current balance is %6$s. Current monthly payment is %7$s. Minimum monthly payment is %8$s. Interest as at %9$s is %10$s. Your home may be repossessed if you do not keep up repayments on your mortgage.

Your mortgage details. Next payment due on the %1$s. Remaining mortgage term is %2$s. Double tap to hide mortgage details.

"Current monthly payment. This is the amount that you've agreed to pay on your mortgage sub account each month. It includes the minimum monthly payment, overpayments that you've arranged, insurance premiums (if these are added to your mortgage) and any extra payments to pay off arrears. If you have recently made any changes to your mortgage, the new payment will not show here until you have paid it for the first time. Minimum monthly payment. This is the monthly mortgage sub account payment excluding any extra payments you have agreed to pay-off arrears and you might make for other reasons for example insurance premiums. This is the minimum amount that is payable to us each month to maintain your mortgage sub account agreement. It may go up or down when interest rates change or if you choose to make other changes to your mortgage. We’ll always tell you before we change it."

Create your memorable information. Must contain between 6 and 15 characters, at least 3 letters and 1 number, and no special characters.

Your memorable information must be between %1$s and %2$s characters. It must contain at least %3$s letters and %4$s number. Use letters and numbers only – no special characters. It must not be the same as your username or password.

Your memorable information cannot be the same as your username or password.

Your accounts page. Shows an overview of your accounts

"With our Pay Contact service you can make payments to your phone contacts using just their mobile number, if they're registered with Paym. It's quick, easy and secure – and you won't need to exchange any bank details. You don't need to be registered yourself to make payments. If you do register with Paym, other people can pay you using your mobile number too."

"We have to collect some data while you use this app. We need this to make the app work and keep it secure, and to comply with regulations.
We'd also like your consent to collect data while you use this app to help us:
• Study how people use the app and our other services, so we can improve them
• Decide which of our products, services and offers may be relevant for you
• Tailor the marketing you see on social media, apps and other websites.
Don't worry, you can change your mind at any time in 'My personal details'. You can also learn more about how we use your data in our %1$s."

"Please note: Collection of some data is essential for us to run the app and we will continue to collect this.
You can find out more in our %1$s."
"We'd like your consent to collect data while you use this app for the reasons below."
This data tells us how you and our other customers use the app. We study it to help improve our online and other services.

"This helps us decide what products, services and offers may be relevant for you.
We may use this data to tailor the marketing you see on social media, apps and other websites."
"You don't have an email account set up on this device. Please add an email account and try again."

"Please leave your feedback in the space below. (If you're telling us about a problem, please let us know where in the app you were, the steps you followed, any error messages you saw and whether the problem happened more than once.)
>
Note: • Please DON'T include your sign-in details or any sensitive information about your account, such as your sort code, account number or PIN. • While we value your feedback, we don’t reply to you personally. • By sending this email, you agree to provide Halifax with your email address. We won't use this email address for notifications and it won't replace any email addresses you have already registered with us.

"Please answer the following questions:
"
" 1. Did you encounter any problems when using the app ? (Yes or no) "" >
"
" 2. If yes, what were you doing when you encountered the problem ? "" >
"
" 3. Please explain the problem encountered in as much detail as possible, including the steps followed and any error messages seen on the screen. "" >
"
" 4. Has the issue happened just once or, if you follow the same steps, does the same thing happen ? "" >
"
" 5. What was the time and date of your issue ? "" >
"
" 6. If you've raised an issue, please provide your Internet Banking username so we can investigate the issue (optional). We will not use this information for any other purposes. Your username can be found in \"Your Profile\" in the app "" >
"
" 7. Any other feedback ? "" >

"Reset the app and de-register this device if you don't want to use it for Mobile Banking. Make sure you've updated your mobile phone number before de-registering your device. We need to call you to register any new device you want to use for Mobile Banking. If you decide to use your old device again, you'll need to re-register it with the app."
Are you sure you want to reset the app and de-register your device?
This action can only be reversed by re-registering your device.

"You should receive your One Time Password in the post within 7 days of your request. Haven't received it?"

You should receive your password in the post within 3–5 days, along with instructions to complete the registration process. In the meantime, you can still use our Internet Banking site to access your accounts, make payments and more.

"To have your address updated, drop into one of our branches or call us on +44 113 242 1984 if you are registered with Telephone Banking. Or go to our Online Banking site, download a change of address form and send it completed to: Halifax PO Box 548 Leeds LS1 1WU"

"Your memorable information forms part of your sign in details and should be a word known only to you. For security, you'll be asked for 3 randomly chosen characters whenever you log on. Note: Your memorable information is submitted as soon as you enter the last character."

"Fingerprint Sign-in is not enabled. Please try again later."
Next time, why not sign in with your fingerprint? Heading
Important:" If anyone else has fingerprints registered on this device, you shouldn't use Fingerprint Sign-in for Mobile Banking."

"Sign in to Mobile Banking using just the fingerprints you have registered on this device.
You can turn Fingerprint Sign-in off or on in the app's security settings at any time."

"You can't use Fingerprint Sign-in for Mobile Banking on this device right now. This is because another person could access your accounts with their fingerprints.
You can still sign in using your memorable information."
Are you the only person with fingerprints registered on this device?

"You shouldn't sign in this way if anyone else has fingerprints registered on this device. This is because they could access your accounts.
You're responsible for all Mobile Banking transactions authorised on this device using Fingerprint Sign-in."

"The fingerprints registered on this device have changed since you last logged in.
Just this time, for your security, please sign in with your memorable information instead of your fingerprint."
Are you still the only person with fingerprints registered on this device?

"You should turn off Fingerprint Sign-in for this app if anyone else has fingerprints registered on this device. This is because they could access your accounts.
You're responsible for all Mobile Banking transactions authorised on this device using Fingerprint Sign-in."

"You're attempting to transfer money out of your tax-free ISA account.

Flexible ISA rules allow you to withdraw and replace money from the same ISA account in the same tax year without losing any of your tax-free entitlement. This means that any amount you withdraw will be added to the displayed remaining allowance figure for the tax year ending 5th April.

If you're withdrawing money from a Help to Buy: ISA you won't be able to claim any bonus on the funds you withdraw, and it will take you longer to save enough to qualify for the maximum bonus as you can only pay £200 each month into a Help to Buy: ISA account."

"Your cheque is now being processed. You'll see it listed in Deposit history. Please keep the original until funds are available, in case of queries. View pending transactions in your account details for the total value of cheques currently being processed."

"You're attempting to move money from one ISA to another ISA. Moving money in this way will affect your remaining ISA allowance for the destination ISA. Please consider these other options below first."

"You're attempting to withdraw from your tax-free ISA.

Transferring money to another ISA account? – You can only add new money to one cash ISA each tax year. If you want to transfer money to another ISA account you need to request an ISA transfer form from your destination ISA provider as this protects the tax-free status of the money.

Transferring money to a non-ISA account? – By completing this transaction you will lose the tax-free status on any money you withdraw from your ISA account. Flexible ISA rules allow you to withdraw and replace money from the same ISA account in the same tax year. This means that any amount you withdraw will be added to the remaining allowance figure displayed for the tax year ending 5th April.

If you're withdrawing money from a Help to Buy: ISA you won't be able to claim any bonus on the funds you withdraw, and it will take you longer to save enough to qualify for the maximum bonus as you can only pay £200 each month into a Help to Buy: ISA account."

"Sorry, your Internet connection has been lost so we can't confirm this payment has been made. When your connection is restored, please check your statement transactions and, if the payment was unsuccessful, try again."

You can make an initial deposit of up to £1,000 within 21 calendar days of opening your account. Each calendar month, including the month you opened your account, you can deposit a maximum of £200 by standing order.

"You're nearly there - just one more step!

"This is the amount that you've agreed to pay on your mortgage %1$s each month. It includes the minimum monthly payment, overpayments that you've arranged, insurance premiums (if these are added to your mortgage) and any extra payments to pay off arrears. If you have recently made any changes to your mortgage, the new payment will not show here until you have paid it for the first time."

"The current mortgage balance is the amount you owe and includes all sub accounts. It doesn’t include any interest accrued so far this month, and may not include transactions made in the last few days.
This is not a final settlement figure. If you want to know the amount needed to pay off your mortgage in full, please call us."

This is the monthly mortgage %1$s payment excluding any extra payments you have agreed to pay-off arrears and you might make for other reasons for example insurance premiums. This is the minimum amount that is payable to us each month to maintain your mortgage %2$s agreement. It may go up or down when interest rates change or if you choose to make other changes to your mortgage. We’ll always tell you before we change it.
YOUR HOME MAY BE REPOSSESSED IF YOU DO NOT KEEP UP REPAYMENTS ON YOUR MORTGAGE.
